definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China

sentences.english: Mr. Smith steeps himself in ancient history.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯沉湎於古代史中。

sentences.english: They are not just ancient history.
sentences.chinese: 從這個角度說，十字軍東征不僅僅是古代史。

sentences.english: I am free ya study Chinese history, especially the History of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 我閒遐時研究中國古代史，尤其是清史。

sentences.english: Are there really no historical records of anthropophagy in Europe’s ancient history?
sentences.chinese: 然而，歐洲古代史中真的能擺脫食人族的陰影麼？

sentences.english: Mr Ostler plunges happily into his tales from ancient history.
sentences.chinese: 他很愉快地從古代史轉而進入他的敘述。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese history is a backbone course of history major of the university.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代史是高校歷史專業的主幹課程。

sentences.english: In Chinese ancient history on to write down the brilliant future.
sentences.chinese: 在中國古代史上寫下了輝煌的篇章。

sentences.english: 3) Take plenty of ancient and classical history.
sentences.chinese: 大量學習古代史和經典歷史。

definition: modern history (for China, from the Opium Wars until the fall of the Qing Dynasty, i.e. mid-19th to early 20th century)
narrative history/comprehensive history/a history covering an extended period
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
